abstracts.cdata!:
The Planning Support and Special Studies
            Project for China seeks to achieve three objectives: (a) to
            help strengthen the government's overall development
            policy and planning capability; (b) to identify, prepare
            and, as appropriate, carry out technical assistance
            activities of an intersectoral, innovative or experimental
            nature; and (c) to facilitate generally the implementation
            of the government's program of economic, financial and
            institutional reforms. To that end, the project consists of
            subprojects to achieve these objectives, for which IDA
            financing of $20.7 million is . About two thirds will be
            available for sector planning studies and about one third
            for technical assistance and training. At the
            government's request, a total of $9 million will be
            allocated at the outset for three comprehensive planning
            studies for the iron and steel, petrochemicals and electric
            power sectors. Subprojects will be identified and prepared
            under the technical assistance/special studies and training
            category, totalling $5 million for institution building.
            Given its technical assistance nature, the project is
            broadly justified by the contribution it will make to
            China's overall planning and reform process and by the
            qualitative support it will provide to the Bank's
            economic, sector, lending and technical assistance activities.
